From NPR News in Washington I chased events a caravan of Central American migrants continues to move slowly through southern Mexico on route to the United states
NPR's Carrie Kahn reports that the size of the caravan appears to be decreasing although thousands remain in the group the line of migrants stretch more than a mile highway north out of the town of ... like thousands spent the night and the town's main plaza
The group was headed to the next ... twenty five miles
It was headed to the next town from twenty five miles away earlier in the week the United nations estimated the group at about seven thousand people in the Mexican government has had the numbers are significantly smaller
According to Mexico's interior on Foreign Relations department more than Seventeen hundred people have left a caravan and applied for asylum in Mexico with nearly two hundred more returning voluntarily back to their home countries President Trump has claimed without evidence that the caravan as riddled with criminals
Head of the U.S midterm elections is planning to send eight hundred active duty troops to the southern border Carrie Kahn NPR News Mexico City
Defense secretary Jim Mattis has signed in order to send eight hundred active duty or reserve soldiers to the southern us border the department of homeland security requested military police and engineers to a border patrol agents ahead of the arrival of the migrant caravan as NPR's Tom Bowman reports the troops will play a limited role in the region
Under law policy color taught US law the troops are not supposed to get involved in law enforcement they can provide support functions are engineers military police pilots they are going to be building camps apparently for border patrol but are not getting involved in any kind of law enforcement that'll
NPR's Tom Bowman the largest NATO exercises in more than a decade have opened in Norway as NPR's Frank Langfitt reports the exercise is called trident juncture Eighteen includes two hundred and fifty aircraft and fifty thousand person out
Of the day the exercise are designed to show NATO's deterrence inability to defend against any attack from any direction they're also designed to improve in rubber ability among NATO member countries which became point of emphasis after Russia annexed Crimea in two thousand and fourteen
President Trump has repeatedly criticized NATO member countries for not paying their fair share on defense but the U.S will play a prominent role in these exercises which will feature a U.S aircraft carrier strike group the north Atlantic Treaty Organization would lose tablets during the Cold War to deter the Soviet Union and gain new relevance after the invasion of Crimea
Russia called trident juncture irresponsible that it would inevitably destabilize the military and political situation in the north

In a crack down on corruption that shows no sign of ending the jeep and its former treasury secretary general you're ones that are doing the work used by the prosecution of improperly using funds meant for the Kuala Lumpur airport and another funding used to help the poor both men pleaded not guilty
Is already facing more than thirty charges a money laundering graft and breach of trust involving money diverted from these so called one empty beef steak development fund

Investigators are searching for suspect that the motive for the bomb threats targeting critics of President Trump and CNN too suspicious packages intended for Joe Biden were intercepted before reaching the former vice president on Wednesday

New analysis from the Centers for Disease Control and prevention finds that fewer than forty percent of adults in the United states got a flu shot last year as NPR's Allison Aubrey reports it's a significant decline compared to prior years and may help explain why last year's flu season it was so deadly
A flu shot is the primary way to prevent sickness and that's caused by the flu and the CDC recommends that everyone six months and older get vaccinated annually but last year the flu vaccination rate among adults with just thirty seven percent
This was a significant drop than the previous year what about forty three percent of adults got a flu shot
People sixty five an older who are most at risk were more likely to get a flu shot but experts say the low rate of vaccination overall may help explain last winter it's the ... flu season almost a million people were hospitalized with flu in nearly eighty thousand people died from flu related illness Allison Aubrey NPR

Get caught up with Peter or city ... reviewed Harvard admissions database entered glued to the college discriminates against Asian American applicants in Howard rate them on personal traits and make the final decisions or city ... two thirds of African Americans and
And make the final decisions or city ... says two thirds of African Americans and one half of Spanish applicants are admitted due to what he called racial preferences Harvard argues our city ... analysis is flawed and if the college could not consider race in admissions
It would result in fewer black and Latino students being admitted for NPR News I'm Kirk Carapezza in
